main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted near Columbus, Ohio on the night of 26 February 1954.
interesting points: The object initially appeared stationary and similar in size and color to a star.
After the initial observation, the object accelerated rapidly in another direction and disappeared at a low altitude.
The object was described as circular at first, then becoming more cylindrical as it approached.
The object had various colored lights, including a round white light with a light green halo, two red lights underneath forming a V-shape, and white-orange colored interior lights.
The entire observation lasted between 5 to 7 minutes.
